Hi All,

I am just getting started with Heritrix, and was hoping for some advice 
with respect to limiting a crawl to within a single domain (and any 
sub-domains).

Additionally, I only want html content, no images, css, js, pdf's etc (I 
appreciate I might be missing valid links - however at this point I 
don't need these). My seed list contains a single domain like:

http://www.targetdomain.tld

According to the docs, the crawl scope "DomainScope" is deprecated and 
"DecidingScope" should be used instead. My decide-rules are, in order:

RejectDecideRule
OnDomainsDecideRule
MatchesFilePatternDecideRule
PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule

As I understand it, RejectDecideRule sets the decision to REJECT, which 
being first on list serves as a default action. OnDomains returns ACCEPT 
if a sub-domain of the domains in the seed list, else PASS. My Matches 
file patterns is:

*(?i)(\.(doc|pdf|ppt|swf|js|css|jpg|jpeg|png|gif))$

and returns REJECT on a match.

I believe the prerequisite rule is required for DNS, robots.txt (the job 
doesn't seem to run without it). I am writing out using 
MirrorWriterProcessor.

Now the crawl seems to work _reasonably_ well - e.g no images, pdfs, or 
content from other domains etc. However, I still get a .css or two and 
also a number of javascript files (particularly scriptaculous stuff)

Could it be that these stray css, js are somehow "Prerequisites" - and 
so are being ACCEPTED? If so why is that and what can I do to eliminate 
them? Or is there some other possible explanation?

Thanks very much,

Richard.
